experienceMetaphor.name: The Iceberg - What You Don't See
experienceMetaphor.concept: Like an iceberg, intimate partner violence has visible and hidden dimensions. Learners descend through three zones to discover the full depth of IPV dynamics, impacts, and responses.
experienceMetaphor.worldDescription: An ethereal underwater journey from the surface (visible signs) through the twilight zone (sexual violence) to the depths (impact and response). The iceberg metaphor represents how most IPV is hidden beneath the surface.

emotionalArc.beginning: Surface awareness - seeing the visible 10% of IPV
emotionalArc.middle: Twilight descent - understanding hidden dynamics and sexual violence
emotionalArc.end: Deep knowledge - equipped to respond with trauma-informed approaches

surface.name: The Surface Zone
surface.description: The visible tip of the iceberg - recognizing patterns, types, and Power & Control dynamics
surface.visualTreatment: Bright teal waters, aurora lights, clear visibility

twilight.name: The Twilight Zone
twilight.description: Deeper waters where light fades - understanding sexual violence, rape culture, and hidden assaults
twilight.visualTreatment: Blue-purple gradient, dimming light, mysterious depths

deep.name: The Deep
deep.module: Module 3: Responding to Intimate Partner Violence
deep.description: The profound depths - understanding impact, trauma, and survivor-centered response strategies
deep.visualTreatment: Deep navy-purple, volumetric light rays from above, quiet profundity

toneAndVoice.voiceDescription: Speaks as a knowledgeable companion on a journey of discovery, balancing expertise with empathy, wonder with gravity
toneAndVoice.toneDescription: Authoritative yet gentle, like a guide leading learners through deep waters. Acknowledges the weight of the topic while maintaining hope and empowerment.
toneAndVoice.formalityDescription: Professional but approachable - not clinical or detached, not overly casual. Conversational depth.
toneAndVoice.personUsage: Address learner as 'you' for instructions and reflection; use 'we' when discussing shared professional journeys
toneAndVoice.readingLevelNotes: Core content accessible to all; technical/clinical terms always explained in context. Use metaphors to clarify complex concepts.

metaphorConsistency.surface: Use 'surface-level,' 'visible signs,' 'what we can see,' 'the tip of the iceberg'
metaphorConsistency.twilight: Use 'beneath the surface,' 'dimming light,' 'descending deeper,' 'hidden currents'
metaphorConsistency.deep: Use 'profound depths,' 'full understanding,' 'deep waters,' 'illuminating the darkness'

colorPsychologyMapping.teal: #38b2ac - Healing, clarity, safety - use for Surface Zone content and empowerment messaging
colorPsychologyMapping.oceanBlue: #2a5a7a - Depth, trust, professionalism - use for Deep Zone content and response strategies
colorPsychologyMapping.twilightBlue: #4a90a8 - Transition, complexity - use for Twilight Zone and nuanced topics
colorPsychologyMapping.warmGold: #ffd700 - Hope, breaking free, light - use for empowerment, safety, and survivor strength
colorPsychologyMapping.softPeach: #ffd4b8 - Warmth, care, humanity - use for support and compassion messaging
colorPsychologyMapping.deepNavy: #1a1a2e - Foundation, seriousness - use for backgrounds and framing

imageryToContent.style: Ethereal watercolor silhouettes with gradient backgrounds - match image style to content depth
imageryToContent.mood: Contemplative, hopeful, empowering - dreamlike quality that respects the gravity of the topic
imageryToContent.metaphoricalConcepts: Freedom (arms open, light rays), Support (people connecting), Breaking Free (breaking chains), Rising (ascending to light), Protection (shields, safe spaces)

visualDensityToContent.whitespace: Generous breathing room - like surfacing for air between deep dives
visualDensityToContent.typography: Clean, modern Inter font - readable in deep waters and bright surfaces alike
visualDensityToContent.contentPacing: Short paragraphs, clear headings, allow processing time between heavy concepts

traumaInformedPrinciples.predictability: Consistent zone structure, clear navigation, no surprise sensitive content
traumaInformedPrinciples.control: Offer choices, respect learner pace, provide resource access throughout
traumaInformedPrinciples.safety: Prominent 'Need Support?' button always visible, crisis resources at every depth
traumaInformedPrinciples.trustworthiness: Evidence-based information, source attribution, honest acknowledgment of complexity

terminologySubstitutions.use: person who causes harm OR abusive partner (context-dependent)
terminologySubstitutions.rationale: Avoids defining someone solely by behavior; use 'abusive partner' when clarity requires
More inclusive - includes relationships beyond cohabitation
Shifts from blaming survivor to understanding systemic barriers
Avoids implying doubt about survivor accounts
Never assume learner knowledge or survivor recognition of abuse
Both valid; 'victim' for active abuse situations, 'survivor' for empowerment contexts
